reviews.text: I absolutely loved this place! My husband and I were not 100% prepared for all the exhibits we were going to look at. We thought we were going to be there a few hours, and before we knew it we had been there 4! It completely engaged us and had amazing stories on many platforms from artifacts to videos. I can't say enough about this place! Definitely worth it to check it out!

A gem of a museum right here in Fredericksburg, Texas! So much history with real artifacts presented in a clear and fun, interactive environment. The USS Nimitz model ship is amazing, along with all the video and items to look at. Very detailed and family friendly. Staff is friendly and you can tell they care about this place. Don’t miss the outdoor memorials and the beautiful Zen Japanese garden right outside!

This is by far one of the best museums I have ever been to! The quality of the displays rivals The Smithsonian....all in downtown Fredericksburg, Texas! I was truly amazed at how wonderful this place is.  The planes,  boats,  and submarines on display will absolutely amaze you!

It's a maze with no bathrooms! There aren't any guides to ask either. 
Great presentation, if a little long. After meandering through the labyrinth for an hour I finally saw a sign pointing to the bathrooms!

This is an extraordinary capture of the essence of the war in the Pacific during WWII.

I think I could actually spend several days here. I did not go as deep into the details as I'd have liked, based solely on the time I allotted. I'd add several more hours.

This is a treasure!

I absolutely loved this place! My husband and I were not 100% prepared for all the exhibits we were going to look at. We thought we were going to be there a few hours, and before we knew it we had been there 4! It completely engaged us and had amazing stories on many platforms from artifacts to videos. I can't say enough about this place! Definitely worth it to check it out!

A gem of a museum right here in Fredericksburg, Texas! So much history with real artifacts presented in a clear and fun, interactive environment. The USS Nimitz model ship is amazing, along with all the video and items to look at. Very detailed and family friendly. Staff is friendly and you can tell they care about this place. Don’t miss the outdoor memorials and the beautiful Zen Japanese garden right outside!

This is by far one of the best museums I have ever been to! The quality of the displays rivals The Smithsonian....all in downtown Fredericksburg, Texas! I was truly amazed at how wonderful this place is.  The planes,  boats,  and submarines on display will absolutely amaze you!

It's a maze with no bathrooms! There aren't any guides to ask either. 
Great presentation, if a little long. After meandering through the labyrinth for an hour I finally saw a sign pointing to the bathrooms!

This is an extraordinary capture of the essence of the war in the Pacific during WWII.

I think I could actually spend several days here. I did not go as deep into the details as I'd have liked, based solely on the time I allotted. I'd add several more hours.

This is a treasure!

Nice outdoor dining. We went as a group of eight and service was good. Loved the singer who was performing the day we were there (March 16) at lunchtime. I had a chicken caesar salad which was quite good. Note - there are bathrooms both inside and also outside. The lines can get long, so check both spots if one line is really long.

Great little restaurant. Although it was chilly, we sat on the outdoor patio and had lunch. There was a singer on stage and he was great. Food was good and so were the beers. Great atmosphere. Would definitely come back and suggest if you're looking for a  nice low key place to eat.

Food was delicious! I ordered the Reuben and it had to be one of the best I've ever had. The restaurant itself was very nice and clean, I loved the decor. The service was great. There was a band playing outside the Saturday night we were there that in passing seemed really good, and not overwhelmingly loud, so you could still enjoy dinner conversation. I will definitely be going back to visit again.

Food was really good. Have a nice outside patio. Probably the nicest in town. Lots of live music. A place where locals and travelers visit. Staff was friendly and helpful. Sometimes there's a wait what sometimes a waits not bad. I really really enjoyed my last visit there. And plan to go back soon!
Clean place with a great atmosphere!  Love the old well when you walk out.  Also the food is great, had the brats with kraut and German potato salad...mmmm!  Service is excellent as well
Great food and service!! 😋 The decorated indoor and outdoor seating transports you back to Germany. Reasonably priced and their beer is refreshing. A great spot for lunch, dinner, and friends. 😁👍

The most amazing experience of real German flavors I was looking for. This plate is a snack plate with a taste of what you would think Germany taste like. Homemade apple strudel alamode...  there are no words. Perfect portion sizes, perfect price.

I visited this place 4 times in the past while on vacation. I always get the spicy sausage.  My wife loved the potato salad and German Cabbage Rolls. Do yourself a favor and get the fried mushrooms. They were great.

The Reuben was the best I've ever had, and I'm no spring chicken. And as for French fries, crispy seasoned slices of tasty goodness. Their service is second to none. Highly recommend this place for a nice leisure lunch.

Stopped in for an early dinner upon arriving into town. Ordered the schnitzel and sausage plates with the 2 sides each. The food came out a little less than 2 minutes later. I couldn’t believe it. It took less time than I fast food restaurant. Apparently the food was pre-cooked, sitting under a heat lamp waiting for its next customer. I could’ve gone to the local grocery store deli market if I wanted that. The sauerkraut was the only edible side. The schnitzel and sausage were okay, nothing great.

The service and beer were the only positive things I would have to say about this establishment. I would never come back to this place.

Good was awesome, but you need to get here earlier than 5:30 to easily get a seat. Quesadillas were grilled and delicious. They state that their margaritas are poured tall and strong, and they ain't lying. The margaritas are more expensive than some places, but you are definitely getting what you pay for. The outside patio is perfect in the spring.

Food was AWESOME!  Line was long to order both food & drinks, but a great way to catch up with friends.  Live music was great.  I highly recommend if you have nowhere else to be & just want to listen to good music, eat hot/wonderful food.  The staff @ Hondo's was nice * helpful.

The food was very good and the restaurant was very friendly and welcomed our travel buddy, Harry, our Terrier. We sat in their beautiful outdoor area and they provided him with a water bowl to quench his thirst. The food was excellent and we enjoyed a wonderful lunch time break. Would gladly return again.
Great Outdoor eating area. Cool place with great vibe. Ordered the Cobb salad to share with my husband for a light afternoon meal. Definitely will come.back again.

Traditional American diner place with live music, drinks and nice outside seated area with wooden seats. I had ordered the poblano chicken sandwich along with the onion rings and sweet potato fries and they were delicious. Will recommend to visit especially after hiking at enchanted Rock.

Always busy, yet quick and efficient service. As an ex-saucier and chef, most restaurants are underwhelming, but this place has amazing food. Everything is made in-house, fresh, and delicious. Even the house salad is above average. I have taken friends and family there and everyone leaves happy. If the chocolate cake is on the dessert menu, it is utterly sublime, don't miss out on it.
One of the true treasures in Fredericksburg! Locally owned and every time I go, I feel it hasn't changed a bit! Delicious food and courteous staff make it a lovely dining experience.

We received a warm welcome & good service. The food was pleasant & coffee was delicious. I believe the atmosphere is the best feature of this charming place. From what I observed, it's a favorite with the locals too.
It's just ok. Great pimento sandwiches.
Excellent food, wonderful service, cute little shop.
The Chicken Pot Pies are 'To Die For'! Last time I was there they only make a few of them and only on certain days...heh Very homely place!
Oh man, this place is dangerous!  The baked goods and desserts are amazing...
This has become a family tradition for lunch on our way home from River Oaks Lodge.

One of the best burgers I've ever had!

Tucked away in the Texas Hill Country is this down home country store like eatery. It's down home an casual affair makes you just wish you could be a regular.  Simple menu and an "on your honor" system for drinks by the bottle, can, or coffee or tea setup as self service. Burgers are huge and come as you like them. Made fresh and to order there are no short cuts here. They have fresh sliced onion rings and hand cut fries. The fried avocado was amazing!

Great service with a smile and great attitudes!

Remember it's a small place and everything is cooked to order, so don't expect fast service. Sit, relax, and enjoy the laid back atmosphere. If you're in a hurry, you've made the wrong choice in life. 

Come for the burger, but definitely come back on Sunday for the Chicken Fried Steak Special.

Evening specials run Wednesday through Sunday and that goes for the days they are open. Don't say I didn't warn you, you're going to love this place.

Great place to chill and have a beer.  Enjoyed listening to live music.  Close to the bat caves to enjoy them exciting the caves in the summer.  

Good food and a famous burger recommended by Texas Monthly Magazine.

Always enjoy great meals here. Honor system on drinks. Awesome burgers fixed the way you want them. Terrific homemade onion rings and fries. Very friendly staff with great service. We'll be back when in the area.

Alamo Springs was recommended to us by Alan of Elizabeth Haus B & B. My husband and I took his advice and were not disappointed. The Texas Monthly Award Winning burgers did not disappoint!  The onion rings and mushroom strips were also delicious!  

Something original...I liked the idea of their honor system when it came to drinks. They had coolers with beer and soft drinks, and a bar with water and tea. They told you to grab what you wanted and when you paid it was your responsibility to be honest in telling the cashier what you drank. That, to me, shows honor and trust to and of the customers.  

The live band was also amazing!

We enjoyed our time and experience there!

This place is awesome. It's a place off the beaten path, but worth the trek.

Once here try the famous "Texas Monthly" Burger, it's delicious.  Have that with some onion rings and a beer and well my friend, you have a little slice of heaven in the hill country.

Stopped in to warm up from a wet bike ride. This place is amazing. The French onion soup was the best we ever had and the flaming cheese with garlic was da bomb. The staff was beyond friendly!!! Thank you, y’all rock!!!

Quirky great Texas nostalgic atmosphere.  Our server met us at the door,very
Friendly ,  small town feel ,  food was
Outstanding. Shrimp stuffed with blue crab and shrimp was the best !!  Hill country Hullabaloo drink was the perfect accompaniment!!
We are
From Marble Falls and would never have
Known of this place except
For our friend in Fredericksburg. Worth the drive and if you have to wait for your
Food enjoy all the
Vintage posters and signs !!
Very good customer service. Nice little place to go from my ranch. I went on Thanksgiving Day and most things were good but some were just not up to par. Was still nice though.
Love the music. Delicious food. Friendly, helpful staff. Though, it's pretty pricey and average sized portions.

Feb 23. Was excited to eat here. That ended quickly. We arrived at 1:30, cafe closed at 2pm. From the moment we arrived, the waitress made us feel like an inconvenience . Sat us quickly and said she had to get our order into kitchen quick or they'd be mad. Then spent 20 minutes joking with neighbor table who apparently were regulars, but ignored us! Food was ok.  Will probably avoid this place in the future even though we now spend time in Cherry Spring. Rather go to Fredericksburg for decent customer service!
